description.narrative: State and non-State institutions equipped to independently monitor child rights situation aligned with Committee on the Rights of the Child recommendations, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Government and other actors monitor child rights and contribute to evidence-based equitable State policy formulation, programming and budgeting.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: State and non-State institutions equipped to independently monitor child rights situation aligned with Committee on the Rights of the Child recommendations

description.narrative: The National Action Plan for Children and SDGs was drafted and currently been reviewed. The Management information systems (MIS) developed for the Ombudsman office to support the independent monitoring of child rights situation is rolled out to cover all country. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:16/12/2019

title.narrative: National electronic case-management and referral system is functional.

baseline.value: Case management system is not available

target.value: 2019:Case management system is rolled out in all 11 centres

actual.value: 2019:The case management system with integrated child developmental assessment component was rolled out in all 11 Family Support Centers of the SCFWCA.

title.narrative: National child strategy updated, monitored and reported

target.value: 2020:National action plan for children is costed and submitted for endorsement

actual.value: 2019:National Child Action Plan is developed and submitted for revision.
